item.title: One Session to Rule Them All
item.description: This post was originally published on the Wilco blog Today, itâ€™s common for web and mobile applications to hide some or even all of their functionality behind a user authentication prompt. And while registration using email and password is still the standard, most apps prefer to complement it with trusted social networking services (SNS) which have authentication capabilities for 3rd party software. Google, Facebook, and Discord are some of the larger ones, but there are many more out there.
